intro: Ronabea didymocarpos, commonly known as the two-seeded ronabea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release two seeds. Ronabea didymocarpos is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
